Flu.Treatment: Sleep 8–9 hours per day, drink orange juice, and rinse your mouth with warm salt water.
Flu.Surgeon: Visit a doctor if fever is above 39°C and lasts more than 2 days.

Cold.Treatment: Drink warm fluids, rest, and keep the body warm.
Cold.Surgeon: See a doctor if coughing lasts over 10 days or mucus turns green/yellow.

Sore Throat.Treatment: Drink warm water, avoid spicy food, and gargle with salt water.
Sore Throat.Surgeon: Consult a doctor if pain lasts over 5 days or there's white pus in the throat.

Pneumonia.Treatment: Rest, stay warm, and drink plenty of fluids.
Pneumonia.Surgeon: Visit a hospital if experiencing difficulty breathing.
Pneumonia.Medicine: Antibiotics such as amoxicillin or azithromycin (prescribed).

Sinusitis.Treatment: Steam inhalation with warm salt water, avoid dust and smoke.
Sinusitis.Surgeon: See an ENT specialist if persistent headache, fever, and nasal discharge.

Asthma.Treatment: Avoid allergens, use bronchodilators as prescribed.
Asthma.Surgeon: Consult a doctor if attacks occur frequently.

Gastritis.Treatment: Eat moderately, avoid spicy food, and split meals into smaller portions.
Gastritis.Surgeon: Get an endoscopy if the pain is continuous.
Gastritis.Medicine: Omeprazole, antacids, H. pylori treatment if required.

Peptic Ulcer.Treatment: Avoid alcohol, stress, and eat meals on time.
Peptic Ulcer.Surgeon: Visit a gastroenterologist for recurring upper abdominal pain.

Diabetes.Treatment: Control diet, exercise regularly, and monitor blood sugar levels.
Diabetes.Surgeon: See an endocrinologist for a personalized treatment plan.

Hypertension.Treatment: Reduce salt intake, exercise, and maintain a healthy weight.
Hypertension.Surgeon: Have regular checkups to monitor blood pressure.

Coronary Heart Disease.Treatment: Eat low-fat foods, control cholesterol, and exercise lightly.
Coronary Heart Disease.Surgeon: Schedule regular cardiology checkups and ECG tests.

Stroke.Treatment: Adopt a low-salt, low-fat diet, start physical therapy early.
Stroke.Surgeon: Seek emergency care within 3–6 hours of symptoms.

Hepatitis B.Treatment: Avoid alcohol, eat clean food, and rest well.
Hepatitis B.Surgeon: Schedule liver function tests and ultrasound scans regularly.

Hepatitis C.Treatment: Follow a healthy diet, avoid self-medication.
Hepatitis C.Surgeon: Get viral load tests and liver evaluations regularly.

Tuberculosis.Treatment: Take anti-TB medication consistently for 6–9 months.
Tuberculosis.Surgeon: Visit a TB center or respiratory hospital for care.

Hypothyroidism.Surgeon: Schedule regular visits to an endocrinologist.

Anxiety Disorder.Treatment: Practice meditation, yoga, and reduce stress; seek counseling.

Depression.Treatment: Engage in social activities, undergo therapy, and exercise regularly.
Depression.Surgeon: Seek psychiatric help if symptoms last over 2 weeks.

Eczema.Treatment: Moisturize skin, avoid strong soaps and allergens.
Eczema.Surgeon: See a dermatologist for persistent symptoms.

Gout.Treatment: Limit intake of red meat, drink plenty of water, avoid alcohol.
Gout.Surgeon: See a rheumatologist if joints swell or hurt frequently.
